castVector3dToVector3f

public static final javax.vecmath.Vector3f castVector3dToVector3f(javax.vecmath.Vector3d v)
Returns a Vector3f that was converted from a Vector3d. There might be small double conversion inaccuracies when converting the Vector3d.

Parameters:
v - a Vector3d that needs to be converted.
Returns:
A converted Vector3f.

convertVector3fToPoint3f

public static final javax.vecmath.Point3f convertVector3fToPoint3f(javax.vecmath.Vector3f a)
Returns a Point3f that was converted from a Vector3d. To convert a Vector3d to a Point3f, use castVector3dToVector3f(Vector3d) then use this function.

Parameters:
a - a Vector3f that needs to be converted.
Returns:
A converted Point3f.

convertVector3dToPoint3d

public static final javax.vecmath.Point3d convertVector3dToPoint3d(javax.vecmath.Vector3d a)
Returns a Point3d that was converted from a Vector3f. To convert a Vector3f to a Point3d, use castVector3fToVector3d(Vector3f) then use this function.

Parameters:

Returns:
A converted Point3f.

rotateEulerVector3f

public static final javax.vecmath.Vector3f rotateEulerVector3f(float x,
                                                               float y,
                                                               float r)
Returns a Vector3f processed through Euler rotations avoiding Gimbal Lock. Do NOT get rotation on the Y axis and rotation on the X axis mixed up. Rotation on the X axis means the Y value goes up and down from the Origin (0,0,0) Rotation on the Y axis means the new X value traveling along the X axis goes left and right from the Origin (0,0,0)

Parameters:
x - a float denoting the rotation on the Y axis.
y - a float denoting the rotation on the X axis.
r - a float denoting the radius of the rotation.
Returns:
a Vector3f giving a position of the rotation.

rotateEulerVector3d

public static final javax.vecmath.Vector3d rotateEulerVector3d(double x,
                                                               double y,
                                                               double r)
Returns a Vector3d processed through Euler rotations avoiding Gimbal Lock. Do NOT get rotation on the Y axis and rotation on the X axis mixed up. Rotation on the X axis means the Y value goes up and down from the Origin (0,0,0) Rotation on the Y axis means the new X value traveling along the X axis goes left and right from the Origin (0,0,0)

Parameters:
x - a double denoting the rotation on the Y axis.
y - a double denoting the rotation on the X axis.
r - a double denoting the radius of the rotation.
Returns:
a Vector3d giving a position of the rotation.

mulMatrix4dByVector4d

public static final javax.vecmath.Vector4d mulMatrix4dByVector4d(javax.vecmath.Matrix4d m,
                                                                 javax.vecmath.Vector4d v)
Multiplies a Matrix4d by a Vector4d and returns a Vector4d as the result. This is one of the simple matrix multiplication methods.

Parameters:

v - the Vector4d.
Returns:
a Vector4d representing the end product of the multiplication.

print3DType

public static final String print3DType(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D t)
Takes a Transform3D and returns the Transform Type.

Parameters:
t - the Transform3D to be measured.
Returns:
a String containing the Transform Type of t. If the Transform Type of t does not match with any of the Transform Types, returns "NONE"
